Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with root of handle; white slip; interior glazed (almost completely lost); two faded added white bands; exterior: reserved, with trace of reddish orange fired line above handle root; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0942) (phase 2)
